title: Market Basket appoints interim CEO to replace Arthur T. Demoulas
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Business Interim CEO Don Mulligan was one of the Market Basket executives who stood by Arthur T.
Demoulas during the infamous 2014 power struggle.
Shopping carts are seen outside of Market Basket in Woburn last month.

title: A former Apple exec just gave UMass Amherst its largest donation ever. Here’s how much.
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Education The College of Engineering will be renamed to commemorate the donation from alumnus Daniel Riccio Jr.
Daniel Riccio Jr.
made the largest donation in UMass' history on Monday.

title: Big E 2025: Best fried foods, desserts, and meals to skip

bullets: Food Big E 2025 food guide: From fried tacos to loaded baked potatoes, here’s what our food reporter found.

title: MBTA police looking for suspect who allegedly pushed elderly person off bus

bullets: Crime The suspect was with an infant at the time of the incident, police say.

title: Robert Redford, Oscar-winning actor, director, and indie patriarch, dies at 89
author: The Associated Press
bullets: Entertainment After rising to stardom in the 1960s, Redford was one of the biggest stars of the ’70s with such films as “The Candidate,” “All the President’s Men” and “The Way We Were,” capping that decade with the best director Oscar for 1980's “Ordinary People,” which also won best picture.
Robert Redford, in 2018.
Charles Sykes / Invision / AP, File ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: Healey’s GOP rivals want to put the brakes on state flag change
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Local News “When I’m elected Governor, we’ll keep the Massachusetts flag and our historic motto,” an opponent to Healey wrote on X.
The Massachusetts state flag, along with the Pride flag, flown in June.

title: In Tanner Jeannot, Bruins believe they have far more than just a bruiser on the ice
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bruins “I want to just help out as much as I can with being a leader to some of the younger guys.
" Tanner Jeannot is looking to more than just physicality to Boston's roster.
AP Photo/Jayne Kamin-Oncea By Conor Ryan September 15, 2025 4 minutes to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: Red Sox prospect Connelly Early will start his first game at Fenway Park this week
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Red Sox Boston's reshuffled rotation has Garrett Crochet in line to start the Red Sox's first postseason game later this month.
Early struck out 11 batters in his first MLB start last week.

AP Photo/Scott Marshall By Conor Ryan September 15, 2025 2 minutes to read After dominating the Athletics in his first big-league start last week, Red Sox prospect Connelly Early is set to face the A’s once again in his second outing with Boston.

title: Close Boston City Council race in District 7 could go to a recount
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Politics In the uniquely tight race, the top five candidates all came within 1.
38 percentage points of each other.
Two move forward to the November general election.
